title.narrative: Youth and NGO's as agents of change in the Middle East and North Africa

description.narrative: Youth and NGO's as agents of change in the Middle East and North Africa

title.narrative: Strengthen knowledge of Denmark and the Arab Region respectively and increase mutual understanding as well as established contacts and partnerships between individuals and organisations and strengthened their capacity to cooperate

target.value: By the end of 2014. at least 18 Danish-Arab partnerships will have contributed to enhancing capacities of and opportunities for young people to influence social change in the MENA Region

actual.value: 12 new partnerships between Danish and Arab organisations have been funded by the DEMENA Pool between 2012 and 2014

target.value: By the end of 2014. at least 18 Danish-Arab partnerships will have contributed to enhancing capacities of and opportunities for young people to influence social change in the MENA Region

actual.value: 12 new partnerships between Danish and Arab organisations have been funded by the DEMENA Pool between 2012 and 2014

title.narrative: Increase the competencies of and opportunities for young activists and youth groups to engage in and influence social and political change processes

actual.value: 17 issues have been raised with local authorities including youth unemployment. political participation of youth in local governance. women’s rights violations. access to public services and public spaces. government accountability in addressing social problems. This has happened through lobbying. dialogue meetings. and open discussion panels and supported by strategic media campaigns.

17 issues have been raised with local authorities including youth unemployment. political participation of youth in local governance. women’s rights violations. access to public services and public spaces. government accountability in addressing social problems. This has happened through lobbying. dialogue meetings. and open discussion panels and supported by strategic media campaigns.

title.narrative: Increase the competencies of and opportunities for young activists and youth groups to engage in and influence social and political change processes

target.value: 15 CSOs and youth groups have taken concrete action to advocate for social change (by lobbying with concerned stakeholders. demonstrated. conducted campaigns. protested in media etc.)

actual.value: 19 CSOs and youth groups have taken concrete action to advocate for social change by lobbying with concerned stakeholders. facilitating dialogue meetings between youth and local authorities. monitoring and raising awareness about human rights and women’s rights violations. campaigning. demonstrating and protesting in media etc. This has been possible through tailor-made trainings for staff. peer-to-peer support and facilitation of strategic reflections and alliance building.

target.value: 15 CSOs and youth groups have taken concrete action to advocate for social change (by lobbying with concerned stakeholders. demonstrated. conducted campaigns. protested in media etc.)

actual.value: 19 CSOs and youth groups have taken concrete action to advocate for social change by lobbying with concerned stakeholders. facilitating dialogue meetings between youth and local authorities. monitoring and raising awareness about human rights and women’s rights violations. campaigning. demonstrating and protesting in media etc. This has been possible through tailor-made trainings for staff. peer-to-peer support and facilitation of strategic reflections and alliance building.

title.narrative: Strengthen knowledge of Denmark and the Arab Region respectively and increase mutual understanding as well as established contacts and partnerships between individuals and organisations and strengthened their capacity to cooperate

target.value: 2.000 young Danish and Arab women and men who have engaged in dialogue or participated in partnerships. intercultural exchange activities or other encounters

actual.value: 1974 youth Danish and Arab women and men have engaged in or participated in partnerships. intercultural exchange activities or other encounters through internships. volunteer placement. training activities. a DEMENA pool conference in Denmark and supported Danish-Arab partnerships.

target.value: 2.000 young Danish and Arab women and men who have engaged in dialogue or participated in partnerships. intercultural exchange activities or other encounters

actual.value: 1974 youth Danish and Arab women and men have engaged in or participated in partnerships. intercultural exchange activities or other encounters through internships. volunteer placement. training activities. a DEMENA pool conference in Denmark and supported Danish-Arab partnerships.

title.narrative: Increase the competencies of and opportunities for young activists and youth groups to engage in and influence social and political change processes

actual.value: 19 CSOs and youth groups have taken concrete action to advocate for social change by lobbying with concerned stakeholders. facilitating dialogue meetings between youth and local authorities. monitoring and raising awareness about human rights and women’s rights violations. campaigning. demonstrating and protesting in media etc. This has been possible through tailor-made trainings for staff. peer-to-peer support and facilitation of strategic reflections and alliance building.

2926 young men and women from student unions. youth initiatives and CSOs in Jordan. Egypt. Lebanon. Tunisia. Morocco. Palestine. Syria. Turkey and Yemen have been trained and increased their capacities in leadership. campaigning. advocacy. coalition building. community resource mapping. decentralisation. gender analysis. creative activism. human rights. anti-radicalisation. electoral campaigning. social media and facilitation.

title.narrative: Develop the capacity of NGOs/CSOs to become advocates for change with a more egalitarian and participatory approach to empowering and engaging young women and men

target.value: 1600 young women and men who have shown civic engagement by analysing social issues. engaging in youth groups or NGOs. participated in events. demonstrations. advocacy activities. campaigns etc.

actual.value: 4263 young women and men who have been mobilised and organised and have shown civic engagement by monitoring human rights and women’s rights violations; formulating joint youth visions; raising local issues with authorities and media; campaigning and advocating for women’s rights. access to public spaces and for youth participation in local governance; developing ICT tools to fight corruption; and establishing local youth councils and networks

target.value: 1600 young women and men who have shown civic engagement by analysing social issues. engaging in youth groups or NGOs. participated in events. demonstrations. advocacy activities. campaigns etc.

actual.value: 4263 young women and men who have been mobilised and organised and have shown civic engagement by monitoring human rights and women’s rights violations; formulating joint youth visions; raising local issues with authorities and media; campaigning and advocating for women’s rights. access to public spaces and for youth participation in local governance; developing ICT tools to fight corruption; and establishing local youth councils and networks

title.narrative: Develop the capacity of NGOs/CSOs to become advocates for change with a more egalitarian and participatory approach to empowering and engaging young women and men

target.value: 8 of the partners have increased the representation of young people in their boards. working committees etc

actual.value: 9 partners have increased the representation of young people in their boards. working committees etc. and youth are now taking part in coordination. planning and implementation of programs.

target.value: 8 of the partners have increased the representation of young people in their boards. working committees etc

actual.value: 9 partners have increased the representation of young people in their boards. working committees etc. and youth are now taking part in coordination. planning and implementation of programs.

title.narrative: Develop the capacity of NGOs/CSOs to become advocates for change with a more egalitarian and participatory approach to empowering and engaging young women and men

target.value: 8 youth groups/CBOs/NGOs have adopted innovative ways of working on citizenship education and civic engagement for youth

actual.value: A total of 25 youth groups. CBOs and NGOs have been trained and developed capacities in innovative and creative approaches to social change and have adopted innovative ways of working on citizenship education and civic engagement for youth. This has been done through music. theatrical street performances. flash mobs. street arts. dancing. painting. video. photography. among others.

target.value: 8 youth groups/CBOs/NGOs have adopted innovative ways of working on citizenship education and civic engagement for youth

actual.value: A total of 25 youth groups. CBOs and NGOs have been trained and developed capacities in innovative and creative approaches to social change and have adopted innovative ways of working on citizenship education and civic engagement for youth. This has been done through music. theatrical street performances. flash mobs. street arts. dancing. painting. video. photography. among others.
